Amy spent a good chunk of the afternoon after eating lunch just lazing around. Normally, she would have been attending to the different variables of her experiment, but with her accomplishment today she felt that she'd earned an afternoon off. Plus, it gave her the time to ruminate on her decision.

It didn't take her that long to decide that she had to share this with somebody. This wasn't the kind of discovery one kept to oneself; the results of Amy's discovery could change the very way that magic was performed on Mogoria itself! Besides which, what if she died before the information spread? She was a sorceress; it was entirely possible that she'd meet her end at the spell of another wizard, a summoned monster, or worse. No, she had to tell someone. But who to tell?

As Amy thought on the decision, she decided to draw up a hot bath. She always thought better when she was soaking. She headed into the bathing room of her tower, where an enormous stone tub sat in the middle. Amy first used a spell that filled the tub with water. She then magically lit a fire under the tub, and in no time at all some steam began to rise from the water. Amy smiled as she shrugged off her robe. It had taken only a basic water and fire spell to do what she just did, and she'd barely used any of her mana at all to cast them both. Just one more point showing that her theory was sound.

After thinking about her theory, Amy looked down at her body. Her breasts had become bigger in the months following the experiment, and she ran her fingers along her wide hips and fleshy thighs. They were both soft to the touch. She couldn't actually see them, due to how far out her belly was protruding. It was still stuffed full of the large lunch that she had just eaten, but quite a lot of its mass was pure fat. Amy smirked as she now rubbed her belly; who knew that the stomach was the biggest generator of magical power in the body?

That thought brought her back to her dilemma. Amy continued to think on it as she slid into the tub, her bulk causing some of the water to overflow the tub and splash down on the floor. Amy could come up with two main ways she could present her information. First off, she could share it with a few of her closest friends. She'd been keeping them in the loop about her experiments (they had noticed her growing gut, after all), and after some of the favors they'd done for her, it would be nice to help them back.

Then again, she could also present her findings to the Mogorian Circle of Sorcerers. There would be those among the Circle that would dismiss their work, but if Amy could convince enough of the wizards on the Circle that what she had discovered was true, then the next generation of Mogoria's mages would be fatter and more powerful then ever.

Amy thought about both options for a while as she soaked in the hot water, rubbing her bulging belly.
142311.title: Sharing, but with whom?

choices: Both of them can make it to dinner tonight.
One of them is held up.
1423111.content:
Amy got out of the bath after a good long while, and used a spell to dry her body immediately. She decided to go for a more casual sort of clothing for the afternoon, putting on a loose cotton shirt that went partway down her gut, and a skirt that was starting to feel kind of tight. After dressing herself, Amy went into her study, where she began composing two letters.

One was to Lietha, a woman of human and elvish descent. Amy's teacher and Lietha's teachers had been good friends, and consequently the sorcerer's apprentices had spent time together. Lietha, unlike Amy, studied transformation magic. She had long blonde hair, pointed ears, and the slim body that was vogue among wizards. Well, not entirely; her breasts and hips gave her an exaggerated hourglass shape, one that wasn't quite wide enough to be considered scandalous. Although it might end up widening, if Lietha agreed with Amy's conclusions.

The other letter was addressed to Brianna, a young woman who up until last year had been Amy's apprentice. Brianna had brown hair, blue eyes, and an excess of enthusiasm for everything that she did. Brianna had helped Amy some with her grand experiment, and had consequently left Amy's tower after her graduation with pear-shaped hips and a bigger bottom. Not that Brianna had seemed to mind all that much; her excitement for what the experiment could mean nearly matched Amy's own.

Her letters composed (both asking the recipients to meet her for dinner at her tower tonight), Amy sent them flying away with a seeking spell. It probably wouldn't take too long for her to get a reply; Lietha and Brianna lived fairly close by, after all.
1423111.title: Info for the Friends

choices: Do it the old fashioned way; eat and get fatter.
Research into magical ways of making herself fatter.
142312.content:
Amy decided that there was no reason she had to tell anyone about this discovery. She could make a record of it in her grimoire and then if something was to happen to her or she changed her mind, she could share it with the world.

With a groan, she moved to her study and set to work. First, she ensured her grimoire was properly enchanted so that only she could read it. Then she set about copying her research and results to the grimoire. Once everything was copied, Amy disposed of the rest of her notes. That way only she knew of this discovery.

The next step was to make use of this knowledge. If Amy wanted to truly be the most powerful sorceress in the land, she also needed to be the fattest and that could take some time. She could do it the old fashioned way and simply eat more and move less. It might draw some suspicion, but it would be no trouble to order the kitchen staff to increase her meal sizes. It would take some time, but it was the simplest and probably safest way.

On the other hand, she was a sorceress. She had great knowledge of the arcane arts and access to the Great Archive. There was bound to be something magical that could make her fatter. Be it a spell or ritual, maybe a spirit or a demon, or maybe some relic in a ruin somewhere. IT would be great practice in the magical arts that Amy would always welcome, exciting, and overall faster. On the other hand it posed more risks to herself and that someone might suspect something was up.

After thinking long and hard, Amy decided what she would do.
142312.title: Hoarding Knowledge

choices: Amy decides to adventure solo.
Amy decides to seek out some adventuring companions.
14232.content:
Amy dutifully copied down the data of her latest test, and then began going over the results. After a few hours of pouring over her months experiments, trying to discover a pattern to the data, Amy was forced to conclude that she couldn't find any. There seemed to be a slight correlation between the amount of fat on her body and the amount of power her fireballs packed, but it wasn't strong enough to definitely say anything. And Amy knew that if she wanted her theory to stand up to the scrutiny of the mages on the High Council, she'd have to have results that were much more conclusive.

After that, Amy took a look at something else that was beginning to concern her; her expenses. Between the lavish meals she'd been eating at the general cost it took to maintain a tower, her funds were beginning to run dry. Even the royal salary she was earning wasn't quite enough to cover everything. Amy had tried to appeal to the finance minister of the kingdom to increase her pay, but the musty old dwarf had apologized and said that money was tight everywhere. After looking over her ledger, trying to see what things she might be able to do without, she sighed and set it down. She was just too accustomed to her lifestyle, and couldn't imagine doing without anything. Which meant she'd have to find a way to make more money, and only one way leapt to her mind.

Amy despised adventuring. She really did. She had delved into a few ruins and goblin caves after finishing her apprenticeship, as most young mages did. Everything about the whole enterprise she found revolting. It was tiring, dirty, dangerous work, and one was expected to eat lightly while doing so. However, the treasure that one found in an undiscovered tomb or a dragon's hoard would be an awfully convenient way to solve Amy's money problems. And until those were solved, she wouldn't be able to continue her experiments.

As she looked around her tower for odds and ends that would be useful while adventuring, Amy thought about how she should go about the enterprise. Mainly, if she should try and go it alone or not. If she searched a ruin on her own and found some treasure, she'd be able to keep all of it for herself. But splitting the treasure with a party also meant splitting the risk, in case she ran into something that her magic couldn't work on. She made her decision after she had gotten everything ready.
14232.title: Inconclusive Results

choices: Amy talks to the dwarves.
Amy talks to the winner of the drinking contest.
142322.content:
After leaving her tower, Amy followed the road into town. She'd put on an adventuring robe, which was a plain but sturdy garment. The belt that cinched it around her chubby waist was rather fancy though, with gold embroidery and a silver buckle. Tied to the belt was a magical pouch that was much bigger on the inside than it looked, in which Amy had stored the rest of her adventuring supplies. With her, she carried a solid oak staff topped with a carved ruby. She looked every bit the adventuring mage, albeit one who was chunkier than most adventurers usually were.

Once she reached town, she made her way to the most popular destination for adventurers, the Dancing Goblin Tavern. She could smell it even before she saw the building. It took Amy a few moments to work up the nerve to go inside. Not because she was afraid, but because a part of her was still trying to find any other way she could make money other than adventuring. When she had determined that, no, she had to do this, Amy headed into the building with a sigh.

Like it usually was, the tavern was filled with all sorts of different people. There were a couple of elves who were playing cards at a table in the back, a group of gnomes appeared to be playing a game involving dice, and onstage a few bards were singing a song about adventuring. After looking over the room, two possibilities for companions became immediately apparent to Amy. Amy was an excellent magician, but terrible at hand-to-hand combat. Therefore, she needed someone who knew how to fight up close with her. The first possibility was a trio of dwarves who were currently being served drinks by the goblin bartender. The other was to be found at a table where an orc and a barbaric-looked blonde woman were engaged in a drinking contest.
142322.title: You Must Gather Your Party Before Venturing Forth

choices: Helga knows where an old ruined city it.
Helga proposes that they hunt down and kill a dragon.
1423222.content:
Something about the woman currently outdrinking the orc picked at Amy's memory, and she wandered over to the crowd that had gathered around the table she was sitting at. Currently, Amy could only really see the woman's blonde hair, since many of the bar's patrons were in the way. Said patrons would let out a loud cheer whenever a drink was taken. Amy had just made it to the edge of the crowd when they all gasped loudly. Amy peeked through to see that after having one drink too many, the orcish competitor had passed out. There was a final loud cheer, and some patrons handed coins over to others, the results of bets made on who would win.

As the crowd dispersed, Amy got a better look at the woman. The blonde got a good look at Amy too, and in a flash she had gotten up and wrapped Amy in a bone-crunching hug.

"Amy! Is good to see you!" she shouted in a thick accent.

"Good to see you too Helga..." Amy wheezed, the breath driven out of her lungs. She now remembered who the blonde woman was. Her name was Helga Bearpaw, and back when Amy had been adventuring Helga had been one of her companions. Helga was a barbarian woman from the Bear Tribe in the Northern glacier, and one of the fiercest warriors that Amy had ever known. Berserkers from the Northern Tribes had a reputation as some of the deadliest warriors around, and Helga had lived up to that reputation back when Amy had adventured with her years ago.

When Helga released her hug and stepped back, Amy got a good look at her. Helga's unkempt blonde hair swirled about her head and fell to her back. Her skin was incredibly pale, and was marked all over with blue ink. Helga's face, chest, arms, abdomen, and legs all had designs tattooed on them; the different marks indicated how many enemies she had slain, if Amy remembered what Helga had told her correctly. Helga was currently wearing a fur bikini top and bottom; the Northerners all had developed high body temperatures to help them survive in the frigid conditions of the glacier, and all tended to wear skimpier clothes when in the Southern territories so that they would overheat. This left most of Helga's body on display. Said body was covered in a layer of fat, though Amy knew that under that soft tissue were incredibly powerful muscles. Helga's butt and thighs were definitely the biggest parts of her, which gave her a distinct pear-shaped look. Her belly was also soft, her breasts were pretty big, and her arms were thick due to the powerful muscles she'd needed to develop to swing her giant axe effectively.

"So? What brings you here? Thought you were done adventuring," Helga asked.

"Well... I'm... kind of out of money..." Amy sighed after a moment.

"I think I know where it went," Helga responded with a smirk, poking Amy's round belly.

"You don't really have any room to talk," Amy grumbled back. Her response just made Helga laugh out loud.

"Relax! Just joking! So, you need money, hm? Well, Helga knows where some might be found..." the barbarian woman said slyly.
1423222.title: Helga Bearpaw

choices: Amy tries to diet.
Amy decides not to bother with it.
14233.content:
When the dust cleared, the rock stood, same as it always did. Amy sighed, writing some notes in her journal. She flipped back to the beginning of said journal, 100 pages and 50 pounds ago. If a gain that big didn't affect her magic at all, then it looked like her Master's theory about magic being affected by the caster's body was wrong after all. It took her the rest of the morning to finish her conclusion. She then set the journal down and sat down herself.

Amy idly drummed her fingers on her belly as she ruminated on the past few months. She'd invested quite a lot of time and effort into this line of research, and not seeing it pan out was really disappointing. There was also the matter of her excess weight. While the acolytes down at the Temple of Gaia might have been fine with bigger bodies, wizardly society tended to look down on fatter magicians. Amy couldn't begin to guess why, but she supposed that she should probably at least try to get her thinner body back.
14233.title: Back to the drawing board...

choices: Keep dieting...
She gives into her hunger
142331.content:
She told the chefs to stop serving her such rich food, asked a knight to offer her some physical training, and even elected to practice spells to convert her body fat into smoke--which turned out to be a stupid idea when her body started getting so hot that her clothing burned off.

After a few weeks, she did indeed shed a few pounds--four, to be exact. She came to her lair every day exhausted and sore, and craving tons of cake. She just had dreams where she'd eat and eat and eat until her stomach stopped groaning for food, until her cravings went away. She was so hungry that she barely had time to focus on her magic.

When she did have time, she'd have so little juice in her system that she'd either pass out mid-spell or just lose focus, her eyes drifting toward the kitchen for that amazing food she knew laid just out of sight...
142331.title: Amy tries to diet.

choices: Her sword and shield, which she used to protect others as a Paladin.
Her staff, which she used to perform miraculous blessings in Gaia's name.
A mask, a symbol of the power she wields as an Inquisitor
143.content:
Amy always felt melancholy after finishing morning prayers. She liked feeling a connection with the Gods of Good. It's why she had decided to enter the priesthood of Gaia, the Earth Mother. Goddess of life, Gaia was the mother of all the other gods, and a stern but fair protector of her human children as well.

Yes, Amy liked that connection, but she also had duties to do as servant of Gaia. But of course, she first had to cleanse herself before going about her duties. Gaia had standards that had to be upheld, after all. As she took her daily bath, Amy noted with pleasure that her middle appeared to be a little rounder than it had been before; Gaia desired that all her children be well-fed, after all.

Finally, it was time to get dressed and be on her way. As she headed out to her daily duties, Amy grabbed...
143.title: Gaia's Daughter

choices: ... there is a troll threatening a village that needs to be defeated.
... a caravan of pilgrims needs someone to protect them on the road.
... the royal heir needs a bodyguard, a role you can perform most admirably.
1431.content:
Amy kept her weapons and armor close by. Her sword was a fairly simple weapon, though well-made. Her shield was made of leather, marked with the Earth-symbol that signified her connection with Gaia. She then took her time to don her chainmail armor, and noted that it was getting a little tight on her. She was going to either have to get a new set made or get this set enchanted with a spell that would allow it to grow bigger. That could probably wait, though. Finally, Amy was ready, and headed into the main Temple of Gaia.

In the main temple, Amy soon found Mother Sucressa, the High Priestess of her order. The high priestess was, like most other high-ranking members of Gaia's clergy, extremely fat. It was mostly hidden under the ornate robes of office that she wore, but Sucressa couldn't hide how large she was. Indeed, why should she hide away a blessing from the gods? Sucressa's seat was a huge stone throne carved by the dwarves to specifically hold her bulk.

"Ah, Sir Gainsworth!" Sucressa said with a smile, addressing Amy by her title. "Gaia's blessing be upon you!"

"And upon you, Mother," Amy replied, striking a salute. After waiting for the High Priestess to gesture for her to speak, she then asked, "How may I aid the Goddess and her followers today, Mother?"

Sucressa thought for a moment, and then said, "Actually, there is a task that I need you to do. You see..."
1431.title: The Paladin

choices: There are more trolls who have attacked the village before.
The village is having a festival, and want Amy to be the guest of honor.
14311.content:
"Trolls, Mother Sucressa? How far from the border is this village?" Amy asked.

"A good question. The village in question, Telmah, is near the border of Mogoria. You'll probably need to ride for at least a day to reach it," Sucressa answered.

Amy nodded. Trolls were dangerous foes, but due to the strength of Mogoria's armies and Gaia's holy order, they had mostly been pushed out of the kingdom and were mostly a problem for those villages that were on the fringes where it was more difficult to move an army quickly.

"Very well then. I shall go and protect this village in Gaia's name," Amy said resolutely. She then offered one more salute to the High Priestess.

Sucressa returned the salute, saying, "Gaia's blessings be upon you, Child."

- - - - -

As the High Priestess said, the trip to Telmah was fairly long and tedious. Fortunately, Amy was able to get a horse to make the trip shorter. The steed she had taken was a large and powerful charger, bred to carry the burden of warriors who tended to carry some excess weight. The scenery, fortunately enough, was lovely. It was mid-Spring, and Gaia's touch could be seen all over the kingdom.

Soon enough, Amy arrived at Telmah, and not a moment too soon. In fact, she saw smoke rising above the village before she was even able to see the buildings that made up the quaint settlement. Spurring her steed on the greater speed, Amy soon arrived in the center of town, where she could see a troll wreaking havoc. The monster was currently holding a young man up by his ankles, licking its lips ominously.

The troll was about as tall as Amy was, with green skin that was dotted in some place with warts. This troll was a she, having round breasts on display. She was a mix of toughness and softness, with muscled arms and legs and a round stomach that seemed to be bouncing around. It took Amy a moment to realize that the troll had swallowed someone whole!

Moving quickly, Amy got off her horse and grabbed her sword and shield. She then let out a loud shout of "DROP HIM!!!"

The troll turned to look at her new foe, and dropped the young man that she had grabbed. "Heh. Szo the humies fin'lly szent a fighter?" the troll asked, her voice raspy.

"I'm here to end your reign of terror!" Amy replied, before moving in to engage the thing. The troll followed suit, hefting a large axe in two hands. Amy struck first, wounding the creature in its thigh. The troll roared and swung her axe, but Amy was able to intercept it with her shield, before striking back with her sword again. This was how the battle went; Amy making quick strikes then blocking the inevitable counterblow. It was clear that the troll had no real experience fighting a real warrior, and her frustration was mounting. Finally, the troll stepped back and raised her axe with the intention of bringing it down with enough force to cleave Amy's shield in two.

Amy saw her chance, and brought her sword across the troll's bulging midsection with all of her strength. The troll let out a loud scream as her stomach was cut open, and the person who had been trapped inside, a young girl, tumbled out. Amy then brought her sword back and rammed it into the troll's heart. The troll stumbled back a few paces before falling over onto the ground.

Her opponent down for the count, Amy turned her attention to the girl she had just cut out of the troll's gut. Her clothes had rotted away and her skin was burned, but the girl was still alive. "A doctor! I need a doctor!" Amy shouted. It didn't take long for the village's healer, an old man, to hobble over. He sprinkled some healing potion over the girl's injured form before having his apprentice, the young man who the troll had been holding earlier, pick the girl up and take her away.

"Thank you for your most timely arrival, Paladin," the doctor said, turning to her. "Any later, and I don't think young Mina would have survived."

"I just wish I could have been here earlier to spare her that pain," Amy replied.

"I know the feeling. My name's Dorm," the old doctor said, offering a hand to Amy.

"I am Sir Amy Gainsworth, of the Order of Gaia. It is a pleasure to meet you, Dr. Dorm," Amy replied, shaking Dorm's hand. She then walked over to the troll's body, looking it over.

"Something wrong?" Dorm asked, confused.

"Unfortunately, it isn't so easy to kill a troll. Look," Amy said, rolling the monster over with her sword. Already, the horrific wounds that Amy had delivered to the troll's belly and breast were healing, and a lot of the shallower cuts she had made early on in the battle had disappeared.

"By the Gods... How do we kill them?" Dorm gasped.

"Fortunately, Gaia has blessed those of my order with the ability to finish these foul things off for good. It does look disturbing though, so look away if you feel you must," Amy explained. She then took off her chainmail shirt, her chubby torso now covered only by the cotton shirt she wore underneath it. Amy then took the troll by the feet, opened her mouth wider than should have been possible, and began to swallow. She tried to do so as quickly as possible, since the troll's flavor was truly repulsive. The troll's gut, while smaller than before, was still rather round and thus hard to take down, but Amy persevered. Finally, it was done, the troll safely taken into Amy's now distended belly, which peeked out from under her shirt.

It took Amy a moment to get to her feet, now burdened by the troll in her stomach. Still, she was able to do so. She then turned to Dorm, who was struck speechless. "Many of the evil monsters of the world have enchantments which makes them hard to kill. Gaia has in turn blessed my order with the ability to return them to the natural cycle. Though as you can see, it is a litte... urp... inefficient. If it wouldn't be too much trouble, might you direct me to an inn where I may rest? I will also need accommodations for my horse."

"Ah... yes, of course. Follow me, Sir Gainsworth," Dorm said, leading her down a street. Fortunately, it seemed like the inn wasn't too far away, and the innkeeper even gave Amy a room for free as thanks for her fending off the troll attack on town. The bed was sturdy enough to hold Amy's weight, and after stripping down to her underclothes, she fell asleep on it, her gut still churning away.

- - - - -

The next morning, Amy woke up feeling refreshed. She pattered her belly, which seemed to have gotten quite a lot of new padding. In fact, all of her seemed to be more well rounded, she found, as she tried to put her clothes on. Her cotton clothes didn't quite fit anymore, her stomach peeking out of her shirt and her trousers fraying a little as they attempted to contain her bigger hips and butt. Amy sighed, deciding to try and seek out someone in town who could make her new clothes. Gaia willing, the tailor hadn't been eaten before she had gotten here. She'd also need new armor, she decided; her chain mail had been tough to get on the day before, and now it would likely be impossible to do so. Amy still decided to take her sword and shield with her; it was just a smart idea.

As she headed out of the inn, she ran into a young man. It took her a moment to recognize him as the apprentice doctor whom she had rescued yesterday. "Good morning, Sir Gainsworth! I'm Mark, and first I'd like to thank you for saving my life and my sister's life yesterday," he said. He didn't quite meet Amy's gaze as he spoke, and there was a luminescent blush on his face as he did so.

"I'm just glad that the both of you are safe," Amy replied, a smile on her face.

"Oh! Uh... Actually, there's something I need to tell you!" Mark said.
14311.title: Troll Trouble

choices: It's a troll war camp, and they're getting ready to go raiding!
It's a troll village, with families there. What's going on here?
143111.content:
"That troll you... uh... ate yesterday! She isn't the only one that's attack the village before!" Mark said.

Amy sighed softly, but otherwise betrayed no emotion. "I see. And where have they been attacking from?"

"Well... uh... To tell you the truth, I was just sent to tell you to see the Council of Elders. They're meeting around noontime in that building in the center of the village, so..."

"Then I'll be there," Amy said, cutting off Mark's rambling explanation. "Actually, it's good you're here. Would you mind showing me around the village? There are a few things that I require before seeing the Council of Elders. Or would I be keeping you from something?"

"O-oh! No, not at all! Master's looking after Mina, and I don't think he'd object to me helping you at all!" Mark replied in a voice that was just a little too loud, desperately trying to keep his eyes looking squarely at Amy's eyes.

"Relax, Mark. I'm not that scary, am I?" Amy asked, amusement dancing in her eyes.

"W-well no! I... I mean, uh... Where did you say you needed to go?" Mark asked, his face getting redder by the second.

Amy let out another sigh.

- - - - -

Amy's first stop was by the tailor. A plump little lady dwarf, she gladly helped Amy find some new clothes to encompass her expanded form. Amy actually had to argue with the tailor to pay her; the dwarf didn't want to take money from the savior of the village, a view that Amy disagreed with. They eventually compromised on a discount, and Amy left the tailor's shop more exhausted than she thought she would be. Nonetheless, her new trousers accentuated her butt nicely (at least, she assumed they did. When she asked Mark to comment, all he did was stutter and stammer and go even redder in the face, which Amy decided was as close to a compliment as she was going to hear from the flustered young man). The button-up cotton shirt also fit nicely, with room for her belly and breasts to expand more (which very well might happen, depending on how many trolls there were).

Mark next showed her to the blacksmith. Her visit here wasn't as fruitful, since the blacksmith, a stout-looking elven man, had no experience crafting weapons or armor, mainly focusing on crafting tools for the farmers to use. The visit wasn't a complete waste of time, since the elf was still able to sharped her sword's blade, lending it a keen edge. This second visit was her last, and soon Mark showed her to the Council building before excusing himself to tend to his sister. Amy waved goodbye to him, before heading into the council room.

- - - - -

There were 5 people on the Council of Elders. Amy recognized old Doctor Dorm, sitting on the very rightmost seat of the council. The leader, another old man, stood up.

"Thank you for meeting us, Sir Gainsworth. I am Jediah, Mayor of Telmah. May I also introduce Doctor Dorm, Mother Hannah, Senel, and May." As he spoke, Jediah indicted Dorm, then a chubby middle-aged woman, a crusty-looking dwarf, and a frail-looking elf. Amy nodded to each of them, also giving a small salute to Hannah, who she recognized as being a part of the Church of Gaia.

"Let's get to the point, Mayor, so that you may be rid of this menace once and for all. Where are the trolls?" Amy asked.

"Glad to hear your serious. The trolls come out of a pass high in the mountains to the West of the Valley. We used to have an old wall that kept monsters in that pass out, but we think they broke through it. We also don't want to send people to repair the wall, since they may just end up as Troll Food," Jediah said, his voice calm and even.

"I see. Is there anything else I need to know?" Amy asked.

"Not that I can remember. Gaia go with you, Sir Gainsworth," Jediah replied.

- - - - -

Fortunately, Amy's horse was able to bear her newly fattened form with little difficulty, and so she rode towards the mountain pass, bearing only her sword and shield. Amy rode the horse for a while until she saw the wall that had been mentioned; there was indeed a huge hole that had been bashed through it. Big enough to let a troll through, but small enough that it could cause a horse problems to get through. Amy got off her horse now, and sent it galloping back to Telmah, knowing that the villagers would take care of it until her return, or her death.

Amy moved through the hole with little difficulty, breathing a little heavier than she usually did. Gaia's blessings allowed her champions to move well even with extra weight, but she'd still need time to fully adjust to it. Her clothes slightly dirty now, Amy moved up the mountain path at a steady pace. She had drawn her sword and readied her shield, ready for anything. For the longest time, it seemed like there was only her in the pass, even the birds quiet. Then, gradually, she heard voices in the distance.

Moving as slowly as she could, Amy came upon the troll settlement. When she finally say it, she gasped.
143111.title: Even More Troll Trouble

choices: Amy challenges the trolls, as demanded by her honor.
Amy forgoes honor to get any advantage she can get.
1431111.content:
Amy took a long while observing the camp. It was fairly small, all things considered, which was a good thing. Still, Amy counted four trolls loitering in it. There were five tents, but Amy had already dispatched one of the trolls already. She brought her hand to her belly as she thought. The only way she could know for sure that the trolls were dead would be to digest them. However, she'd only ever swallowed two things at once. To make sure that the troll threat was eradicated, she would have to devour four trolls at once. Only Gaia would know if she could handle it.

That then brought about another question; how should she get the trolls into her belly? The Paladin Oaths that she had sworn dictated that she face her foes in honorable combat. But this was four-versus-one, and more importantly, if she failed then the village suffered. Did honor really apply here? Amy could see a bend in the rock where she could easily launch an ambush against the trolls. The tight quarters would limit their movements, and give her the advantage. But ambushing wasn't exactly fair, was it?

Amy would have to make her decision quickly. She could her the trolls conversing among themselves, deciding not to wait for their companion anymore. Whether she was going to make an honorable stand or a surprise attack, she would have to do it soon.
1431111.title: The War Camp

choices: A very fat female elft
A skinny, gnarled old troll
14311112.content:
Amy shook her head and took a deep breath. "These foul creatures showed no honor to the innocents of the village. Why should I put even more lives in danger? And why was I given this gift, if not to use it to the fullest?" She patted her midsection, suddenly feeling hungrier. "... praise Gaia," she muttered, almost forgetting it in her move to position her weighty body by the rock for her ambush.

"We wait fer Shrrptngue, ya? More trolls, more fun!" said one, whose voice was raspy but high. Amy couldn't see, but guessed she was another female. "Ugh, nah nah! She eat too many humies ag'n. Prolly take nap, git lost. We go, find 'er on way back," growled another troll. Taking one last peek, Amy saw a male who had the height of a tall human, and despite his girth, a warrior's build. Probably a leader. The other two were short for trolls, but plump, and seemed to defer to his order.

Well, it was now or never.

"Now - feast time!" The leader Troll growled as Amy leapt from the rock. In the air her jaw opened wide and her instincts were on target, she mouthed the foul troll's head and her girth drew her down his thick frame, and she was jostled as he turned to face his assailant but that just made her slide down his chest, his round, hard belly, and soon she was stuffing his large feet into her mouth, all in all just a few seconds and yet somehow, her stomach managed to just contain all that troll meat, which wasn't that bad now that she'd had a sample before.

With a mighty heave of her paladin's muscles, she swung herself to her feet, and her newly-expanded stomach thwacked the next troll, the argumentative she-troll, who landed square on her back. Wasting no time, Amy grabbed this troll by her bare feet and began to stuff her inside, and though Amy's prey had some hips designed to carry a liter of trolls, the hungry paladin did her work and swallowed, and pulled, and swallowed, and though it took longer and felt like ages, Amy now felt completely stuffed with two squirming warriors in her gut.

With fury in her eyes, she turned to the remaining targets. Horrified, they shrieked some Troll word she didn't understand and stuck their wooden clubs at her, as if to poke a ravenous dog away, but before she realized what she was doing her teeth had snapped the weapons in two and, pulling their wrists together, she began to devour them two at a time! She had to ignore the protests of her stomach and the doubt in her mind, and eat! If these monsters weren't digested, they'd surely come back with more... and she just concentrated her imagination on the idea of a score of trolls marching on a peaceful village, their fat bellies hungry for flesh.

Why that image stirred her so, she could not tell. She put one hand to her dizzy head, wondering if she had dreamed what just happened, for she could barely remember... though the pain of a stomach twice as full as she had ever gotten it, brought her to reality. It was far too large for her to even come near reaching around, and though Gaia's gifts let her get shakily to a standing position, even she was shaking with so much mass in front of her, having to dramatically shift her stance to accommodate what was in her digestive tract.

"... that's a whole camp in there," she sighed to herself. "I can hardly believe it."

"In my six hundred years, I can't believe it either." Came a strange voice floating on the air. "A Glutatdor'n, at last."

"Wait, who are you? Is that what those trolls called me?" Amy turned her head, fearful of any sudden movements knocking her off-balance. Then, came the voice's owner, equally as mysterious...
14311112.title: Amy forgoes honor to get any advantage she can ...

choices: Princess Anastasia is as sweet in private as she is in public.
Princess Anastasia's public face is a facade. She's actually rather bitchy!
14313.content:
"I'm sure you remember the assassination attempt upon the Princess last week," Sucressa said.

Amy nodded, with a grim expression on her face. The current heir to Mogoria's monarchy was the eldest daughter of the king, the Princess Anastasia Mogoria, who had just turned 17. It was during the party celebrating her birthday, in fact, that the assassination attempt had occurred. A trio of hooded assailants had leapt from the ceiling, stabbed the princess's bodyguard (a veteran warrior named Mariel), and had nearly gotten to the princess herself before several soldiers had managed to overwhelm them with sheer numbers.

"It looks like Mariel will survive her injuries, but the wounds on her legs didn't heal right. She has had to retire," Sucressa explained, "Which leaves the Princess without a bodyguard. The royal couple asked if there were any among our order who would be up to the task of ensuring that their daughter was safe. I recommended you."

Amy's round face flushed with pride and embarrassment. "Mother... I don't know what to say," she murmured.

"You have served the Order of Gaia faithfully for many years, and have done your brothers and sisters proud. I do not doubt your skill and your compassion," Sucressa said, a smile on her face.

"When do I begin these duties?" Amy asked. There was no need to ask if she would accept the deed; guarding the royal family was an honor that few ever did, and Amy was happy to take up that burden.

"Today, if at all possible. Everyone wants the Princess to be protected as soon as possible," Sucressa answered.

"Then I shall prepare myself for this new duty. Gaia's blessing be upon you, Mother Sucressa," Amy said, before turning to head to her room. There wasn't much to pack, but it was better to have that done quickly.

- - - - -

A few hours later, Amy found herself standing in front of the Princess's room. A servant had led her to a room down the hall where she would be staying, so that she would be close to her charge in case of trouble. Amy was actually very nervous. Princess Anastasia was known far and wide to be a rather generous and kind young woman, and Amy hoped that she would make a good first impression. Slowly, she raised a hand to knock on the door of the Princess's room.
14313.title: The Princess's Bodyguard

choices: ... go adventuring in some ruins with some friends of hers.
... preside over a fertility festival today. Bow chicka bow wow!
... undo a famine in the Eastern Kingdom. Helping always feels good!
1432.content:
Amy grabbed the robes that were traditional for her order, swathed herself in them, then cinched them at the waist with a sash (this, of course, accentuated her growing belly, something she was fine with). She then grabbed a simple-looking oak staff that she had laid by her door. The staff was, of course, blessed in the Temple sanctum, which gave it the ability to help her perform miracles when she invoked Gaia's name.

Amy headed into the temple, saying morning greetings to her superiors there including the High Priestess, Mother Sucressa. Finally, Amy headed out the door, a smile on her face. Today was going to be a good day, she could feel it! After all, she was going to...
1432.title: The Miracle Worker

choices: ... the Tomb of Gloria the Fat, a powerful archmage of a lost era.
... the Temple of Snakes, dedicated to a long-forgotten deity.
14321.content:
Amy took some time to wander the streets of the city of Mogoria. She spent so much time either cooped up inside the temple or adventuring that she didn't get enough time to explore the city as she would have wanted. Still, she couldn't take too long. After all, she had a very important meeting to get to! So after some time, Amy found herself in front of the Dancing Goblin Tavern.

As she headed inside, Amy immediately saw both of the people she was meeting. One stood around 4 and half feet tall, with a stocky frame and a bushy grey beard. This was Rock Steelbeard, a dwarf who had long been a friend of Amy's. He was wearing a suit of chainmail armor, and had a shield fastened to his back and an axe hanging at his hip. He was currently having a pint of beer and joking with Amy's other companion, an elven lady named Rose. Rose stood nearly six feet tall, towering over both Rock and Amy both. She had a slender figure with small breasts, though her hips flared out dramatically enough that no one would mistake her for a man. Said figure was easily seen through her leather armor. Rose had no visible weapons on her, but Amy didn't doubt that the roguish elf had several daggers stashed away on her body.

"Ah! There you are! We were afraid we'd have to leave without you!" Rock shouted as he saw Amy approach the table.

"I was right on time, as I always am!" Amy replied indignantly.

"If you say so. Any, since Amy's here, Rose, why don't you show us that map that you found?" Rock asked.

"With pleasure," Rose said, and with a flourish produced an old-looking parchment out of nowhere. It was a trick that Amy desperately wanted to know how to do; there were a lot of miracles that being a priestess of Gaia allowed her to perform, but pulling objects out of thin air wasn't one of them. The group looked down at the parchment, which as Rock had mentioned, was a map. Specifically, it was a map to...
14321.title: You all meet in a tavern.

choices: The Trio makes it to the tomb with no trouble.
Something decides to attack the Trio in the Badlands.
143211.content:
"An archmage's tomb? That sounds like it would be really dangerous..." Amy murmured, looking at the map.

"Ah, we'll be fine! With my strength, your miracles, and Rose's nimble fingers," Rock replied, adding a suggestive waggle of his eyebrows to the last part of his list, "we should be able to handle whatever that tomb throws at us!"

Rose nodded, a smile on her face. "Think about it this way. Gloria was the one responsible for stealing several relics from the Temple of Gaia centuries ago, right? Would Gaia want to have those back where they really belong?"

"I... You're right. Let's go," Amy said, a look of determination on her face.

"Har! That's what I like to hear!" Rock roared.

It took the trio the better part of a day to leave Mogoria City, traveling to a little-known part of the kingdom known as the Badlands. They were an arid wasteland, not good for farming and having had any resources mined out of them centuries ago. Barely anything lived out there, so theoretically nothing would impede their journey to Gloria's tomb.
143211.title: To Gloria's Tomb

choices: ... a vicious monster!
... a deadly trap!
1432111.content:
The journey through the Badlands was one of the worst things that Amy had yet experienced. It was hot, dusty, and she was constantly thirsty. Furthermore, the Badlands were just not very nice to look at. There was only dust and rock in all directions as far as the eye could see. Amy knew that if it weren't for Rose's flawless internal compass, she would likely be wandering in this desolate corner of the kingdom for a long time.

But at last, after hours of hiking through barren wilderness, a speck appeared on the horizon.As they approached, they soon saw the speck was the front entrance of a large ruined building. Strange designs ran all around the walls on the building, and a stone slab with old writing on it had been placed over the entrance to the ruins.

"That's some old writing. Can't make anything of it," Rose murmured, frowning slightly.

"It's from a language that isn't spoken anymore," Amy said. "Fortunately, I studied it as part of my training. It says 'This is the final resting place of Gloria, Mightiest of mages, Slayer of dragons, and Queen of the world. Beware, ye who enter to steal from her.'"

"Sounds humble," Rock quipped.

"Well... I guess we should enter. No time like the present," Amy said. She stepped forward into the tomb, with Rock and Rose at her side. The entrance hallway led to some stairs that descended into darkness. Rock, whose dwarven eyes allowed him to see in the dark, peered down into the abyss. "Looks safe so far," he stated, before stepping down the stairs. Rose made a flourishing motion, and from out of thin air a small wand appeared. The elf swished the wand, and a small light appeared on the end of it. Meanwhile, Amy said a short prayer which caused a shining halo to appear over her head.

Thus, the three headed down into the tomb. The stars eventually ended in a large chamber, where they suddenly had to contend with...
1432111.title: Into the tomb

choices: Eat it to beat it!
A very dangerous disenchanting miracle
14321111.content:
As soon as Rock pushed the huge door open with his Dwarven strength, Amy felt a dainty hand on her shoulder. Rock also paused, both of them glancing at Rose who had tilted up one of her pointed ears.

"Careful. I just heard something. Like... pottery shattering."

"Ah, probably just the vibrations. I'd wager this door was set to ol' Gloria's heft herself!" Rock joked, giving it one last shove as the massive iron door swung fully open. In truth, none of the three saw anything unusual, and so stepped inside...

And with a surprising speed, the iron door swung shut behind them as easily as if a strong breeze had pushed a tentflap closed!

Rock uttered a curse in his native tongue. Amy rubbed her belly and silently prayed. Though neither could see Rose, they were sure she had hidden in the shadows.

"Great... now I hear them breakings, too," Rock drew his axe.

"Hmm... I smell something... good. Reminds me of the kitchens back in the temple."

"Probably Gloria's perfu- ack!" Rock shouted in alarm, landing hard on his backside (only somewhat padded by his armor). "Step lightly, lasses! I think I found what was making the noise... "

As Amy blinked in disbelief, she saw that Rock seemed to have slipped in a puddle of melted butter! Other clay pots began to shatter around them, the gooey, yellow liquid pooling in the center of the chamber. First it formed a massive puddle, then as more of the fatty stuff came together, it rose up into a blob, finally forming a fat belly, well-rounded breasts, thick arms, and even what looked like a feminine face on a human head!

"A butter beast... never thought I'd actually see one in person, they're not really a popular style," Amy said aloud, mostly stunned at the bizarre sight.

"This ain't no butterknife, you dairy demon!" Rock boasted, and though he managed to keep to his feet this time, his deadly axe merely swept through the butter beast's middle, as ineffective as if he had tried to cut water.

"Please try to keep it busy, friends," Rose briefly appeared between them. "There is an exit, though of course it's locked. And booby trapped."

"You could be less of a sneak and stab it in a weak point," Rock growled, fending off the attack of one buttery hand.

"I'm pretty sure the butter has no weak points," Rose sighed, tired of explaining the limits of her abilities. "I'm a rogue, not a patissiere."

Two sets of eyes were on Amy, who was calling upon a prayer of protection to keep pools of melty stuff from getting under her feet and slipping up her as they did Rock. "Only one way to defeat a butter beast... " she suddenly remembered, nervous at the sight of a big, gooey belly inching towards her.
14321111.title: ... a vicious monster!

choices: Amy's tired, but otherwise fine. Let the adventure continue!
Amy's been cursed! This isn't good.
143211111.content:
As Rock did his best to keep the monster's attention and Rose attempted to disarm the trap that was keeping them locked in the room, Amy attempted to remember everything she knew about butter beasts. The basics came easy to her. Butter beasts were creatures of dark magic, the creation of a powerful arch-demon of the First Circle of Hell who had wanted to destroy Mogoria by using the very food it created to wipe out everyone living in the kingdom. The story went that Gaia herself battled the demon, while her mortal servants fought with the dairy and produce that the demon had cursed to attack the innocent.

Remembering that battle caused Amy to remember how the demon's army had been thwarted. After Gaia had defeated the arch-demon, she'd tried to channel her Holy Energy into the world to disrupt the curse. However, the battle with the demon had weakened her. Things looked hopeless when one of the butter beasts had tried to kill one of Gaia's paladins by forcing itself into her body and destroying it from within. In her moment of despair, the paladin had prayed to Gaia, and the goddess had sent some of her energy to the Paladin despite believing that she had been lost. However, while pure divine energy had dissipated harmlessly around the creatures when channeled into the world directly, it was concentrated in those mortals who were faithful to her. Thus, the butter beast that had tried to kill the paladin was killed and the demonic taint quashed.

However, though many had attempted to destroy the demon's edible army after seeing how the paladin had done it, not everyone was able to channel Gaia's power. Though the creatures were destroyed, many had been cursed with a demonic taint and wasted away over the course of several days. That battle was remembered as one of the greatest triumphs of Gaia's Church and one of its most sorrowful tragedies.

Flashing back to the present, Amy saw the butter beast getting close to her. She was starting to get worried, very worried. That she could defeat the thing was without question. But would she end up cursed? It was said that dying to a demonic curse was one of the most agonizing ways to go, and that those who did so were forced to spend eternity in Hell whether they were good or evil. But if she didn't do this, then Rock and Rose would die for sure. And she wouldn't let that happen.

"You have no power here, monster!" Amy shouted, grabbing the beast's attention. "In the name of Gaia, I rebuke you!" Hearing the name of the Goddess it hated the most, the beast reached out a slippery hand and forced it into Amy's mouth. She heard Rock shout out for her, but Amy help up her hand to stop him. Quickly now, the thing was entering her stomach, which was quickly expanding to accommodate it. Most other people's stomachs would have ruptured by now, but Gaia's blessings (and a habit of stuffing herself silly on feast days) kept that from happening.

Finally, the whole butter beast was inside of her. Amy's abdomen had swollen up like a balloon, her belly positively enormous. She had to lean on her staff just to keep herself upright; she'd overbalance and fall down if she didn't have it. Rock looked at Amy with a mixture of concern and amazement. Slowly, Amy began to recite a long prayer to Gaia, the words had to get out because it had been hard to breathe while the butter beast had been forcing its way into her stomach. The chant grew stronger as she continued with it, and the tip of her staff began to glow. Finally, there was a burst of light as Amy finished her prayer.

When the light had faded, it was clear that something was different. For one, Amy's belly wasn't quite as swollen as it had been. It was still stuffed, straining against the fabric of her robe, but not as much. Amy was also quite visibly exhausted, panting heavily and gripping her staff tightly. She started to sway, but before she fell she could feel Rock's strong arms catch her. She looked up to see his bushy brows furrowed with worry, as well as Rose looking quite concerned.

"Amy? Lass? Are ye okay?" Rock asked.
143211111.title: A butter beast feast

choices: Rock and Rose decide to carry amy back to the Temple of Gaia.
Rock and Rose decide to head deeper into the tomb.
1432111112.content:
"I... I think I'll be..." Amy began, before gasping as she felt it. It was a feeling more horrible than anything she'd ever experienced. She was in pain, nauseous, and felt other, worse things that were indescribable. She wanted to scream, but it felt like she couldn't gather the air in her lungs to do so.

Both Rock and Rose knew something was wrong without Amy having to say anything. "What the hell's happening?" Rock asked.

Rose frowned, and murmured, "I think she's been cursed. I've seen symptoms like this before, but nothing this intense. Whatever foul magic was animating that beast is now tearing Amy's soul apart."

"I figured it was something like that. Lass is to selfless for her own good," Rock said. There was a moment's silence, before Rock said, "So what do we do?"

"I don't know," Rose said, for once in her life at a loss. "I've never been that skilled in the healing arts, and I don't think the healing potions I brought with me will help her at all."

Rock then looked back at the door which led to the entrance. "Well, we can't help, but we know someone who can. The High Priestess in Amy's temple. Surely she's in good enough with the Earth Goddess to ask a for a miracle."

"But will we be able to get there in time before the curse takes Amy's life? It wasn't easy to get here, and we'd have to carry her back," Rose responded.

"Well, what do you suggest!?" Rock snapped. "Like you said, neither of us can remove curses!"

Rose thought for a moment. "Maybe... but there could be a way to do so in this tomb. Most of the books of lore that I read about Gloria indicate that one of the treasures she stole after sacking the Temple of Gaia was an object called the Cornucopia of Healing. It is said that it will never run out of food, and that those who eat of it will be cured of all injuries, sicknesses, and curses."

"But we don't know if that's in here for sure," Rock said. "And we don't know how many more traps and beasties lay between us and where it is in the tomb."

"True," Rose said, "But I think there's a chance that we can find it quickly enough to save her life."

"Well," said Rock, "We need to decide what we're doing, and quick."
1432111112.title: A cursed decision

choices: Amy has been assigned to ferret out a cult in the capitol.
Amy has been assigned to hunt down a heretical priest.
Amy has been assigned to spy on a rival church.
1433.content:
Amy grabbed a grey mask, as well as the hood, cloak, and black robe that went with it. Donning the entire assemble made her anonymous, indistinguishable from every other Inquisitor that the Church of Gaia employed. The Inquisition was not a well-known order within the Church, and those who did know of it tended to be leery of it. But at the end of the day, Amy had a duty to protect the faithful from any spies or traitors within their midst. Those who used Gaia's name to perpetrate atrocities deserved every bad thing that an Inquisitor could do to them. And Amy knew how to do a lot of bad things.

As she left her room in the basement of the temple, she mentally reviewed the assignment that the High Inquisitor had given her last night. Now that she had rested and communed with Gaia, she was ready to see any evil that would prey on her faithful punished.
1433.title: Not Expected

choices: ... A warmongering nation right on Mogoria's borders.
... A plague spreading across the kingdom.
... A dragon which was threatening to burn Mogoria to the ground.
144.content:
High Queen Amy Gainsworth II finished up her prayers with a sigh, then signaled for her royal tailor to come in. As the servant began taking measurements for her new royal robes, Amy reflected on how suddenly her life had changed. Just a week ago, she had only been a princess, content to do whatever she had felt like. That had changed when her mother, the previous High Queen, had suddenly died, for reasons that were still being investigated. And as the Queen's only child, the throne had passed just like that to Amy.

She was feeling rather overwhelmed, to tell the truth. She'd expected to have at least another few years to learn the ins and outs of running a kingdom, but it appeared that fate had decided not to give her that time. So there she stood, getting measured for the robes she'd be wearing to her coronation which would occur in a few days. Of course, the coronation wasn't the only thing on Amy's mind. There was also a crisis in the kingdom, in the form of...
144.title: Long live the Queen!

choices: ... the cult of Hedona, Dark Goddess of Destruction and Gluttony.
... the Lipidia family, nobles who want to usurp the crown of Mogoria.
... the Underground Kingdom of the Dark Elves.
145.content: Amy finished up her little ritual prayer to the Dark Gods around the same time that everyone finished their prayers. It was her little way of spiting the people of the happy kingdom around her. Still, one had to keep up appearances; a kingdom of Mogoria's strength wouldn't fall overnight, not without a lot of preparation. She got up, her round gut and bottom jiggling, as she prepared to go about her day with no one knowing where her real allegiance really lay. Amy's real allegiance was to...
145.title: The Spy

choices: She was headed to her Cargo Ship, ready to bring a delivery to another plant.
She was going to board a passenger ship, ready to go to another world.
She was a member of the Federation Police, tracking a criminal to this port.
She was a xenobiologist, ready to join an expedition to discover new life forms.
Actually, there was no reason. She's something of a wandering space-hobo.
15.content: Sheldon Space Port was named for some great explorer of space, Amy knew that much. She really didn't know who Sheldon was beyond that, or what he had discovered that was important enough to name a Space Port after him. She didn't even know why she had derailed her thoughts into thinking about the man the Space Port was named for. There was a reason she was in the Port, after all...
15.title: The Earth Federation

choices: The Muffin gets attacked by space pirates!
The Muffin flies into a magnetic storm!
The Muffin gets to its destination. How lucky!
151.content:
Amy found herself sitting in a small restaurant, enjoying a tart made with a fruit from some other world with a name that she couldn't pronounce. Said fruit was, in fact, what she would be delivering. Her cargo ship, the Muffin, was currently being loaded with crates of the things. Amy had already filled out the necessary paperwork, so all that was left was waiting for the cargo to be placed in the Muffin's hold. Not that she minded too much. She'd made 3 deliveries over the past 2 weeks, often sleeping in her ship's cramped quarters rather than a comfortable bed. Getting a chance to indulge herself was a rare luxury.

But sadly, all good things had to come to an end. Amy soon finished her tart, and got an alert on her wrist communicator not long after that indicating that all of the fruit containers had been loaded onto her ship.

"Well, back the the grindstone," Amy sighed, getting up. She soon found herself at Dock 113A, where the Muffin sat. The ship itself wasn't too special; it had a cylindrical body that contained the cockpit, living quarters, and cargo bay, with two cylindrical engines on either side of it held to the main body by struts. Still, it was hers, and that counted for a lot. Amy headed into the ship, finding its only other crewmember, a TX-67 robot that she'd named Tex.

"All pre-flight checks have been done, Captain. The ship is ready to fly on your orders," Tex said in a robotic monotone.

"Thanks, Tex. Let's get out of here as soon as we get the okay from ground control," Amy replied, strapping herself into the pilot's chair.

"Will do, Captain," Tex stated, seating himself (well, itself, but Amy preferred to think of Tex as a him) in the co-pilot's seat.

The okay from ground control was given not long afterward, and the Muffin soon found itself leaving Earth's atmosphere and blasting off into space.
151.title: Captain Gainsworth

choices: The ship's engines are damaged, and the Muffin crashes on an alien world.
The storm has caused some... glitches... in Tex's programming.
The refrigeration unit was fried, and the food on the ship is going to go bad.
1512.content:
Amy piloted her ship through Earth's stratosphere and away from the planet. She'd have to be far away enough from the Sun's gravity to engage the Muffin's faster than light drives. Tex was silent, having been ordered to remain so by Amy, since she found talking disrupted her ability to concentrate on her piloting. Finally, the Muffin made it past Neptune, and the FTL indicator on her ship went green. Amy then pushed a button, and the stars all became a blur as her cargo ship became faster than the light that they emitted.

Amy leaned back in her chair with a sigh, before getting up. "I'm going to go take a nap. Haven't had a chance to sleep all day," she said.

"Affirmative. I'll remain at the controls, Captain," Tex replied, moving over to the pilot's seat.

"Thanks. See you later," Amy yawned, heading towards her quarters.

"Rest well, Captain," Tex said.

The trip over to the Muffin's crew cabin wasn't that long at all, considering how small the ship actually was. Amy soon found the cot that she slept in, a space-saving measure so that an even bigger cargo bay could be fit into the Muffin's chassis. She stripped down to her underwear, setting her clothes aside to be washed later. Amy yawned again, clambered into the cot, and soon fell asleep.

An alarm klaxon woke her up quickly. Amy wasn't sure how long it had been; it certainly hadn't been long enough for a decent nap. But emergencies waited for no one, so Amy rushed towards the bridge, not bothering with putting her clothes on. She found herself there within a minute.

"What's going on?" Amy asked with steel in her voice.

"We appear to have entered a magnetic storm, Captain. The sensors didn't pick it up until it was too late," Tex replied in his usual monotone.

"Wonderful. What ELSE could go wrong?" Amy grumbled.
1512.title: Lightning Storms in Space

choices: ... kill all humans!
... feed all humans!
15122.content:
Amy moved towards the Captain's chair, which Tex quickly vacated. As he did so, one of his arms touched the ship's control panel as an electric surge went through the Muffin, causing some of his programming to go on the fritz. Amy didn't notice it right away, since she was too busy swearing at her ship's controls to notice her helper robot leave the cockpit.

Some of Tex's backup systems were attempting to ward off the new directives, but in the end it wasn't enough. Soon, Tex would have a new primary function, which demanded that he...

choices: ... humans find the fruit incredibly addictive.
... the fruit is very, VERY fattening.
15123.content:
"It appears that the refrigeration unit has also malfunctioned, Captain," Tex said, responding to Amy's question.

A groan of frustration escaped Amy's lips, and she banged her head against the console.

"Please do not do that, Captain. Such motion could result in a concussion," Tex stated.

"I'm fine, it's just... Those fruit we're carrying... They spoil really quickly, don't they," Amy sighed.

"The fruit will begin to spoil within 24 hours if not kept properly refrigerated," Tex replied.

"And we're at least two days from the nearest repair station. At least, if the navigation equipment isn't on the fritz too," Amy grumbled.

"The navigation equipment appears to be functioning as intended, Captain," Tex said after looking over the ship's controls for a moment.

"Well, that's one thing that's going our way, at least. Set us on a course for the nearest habitable world where we can repair," Amy said, getting out of the captain's chair and heading out of the cockpit. As she did so, her stomach rumbled, and she placed a hand on her bare belly.

"Do you intend to dine, Captain?" Tex asked.

"Yeah. Might as well have some of that fruit. I mean, it's going bad anyway," Amy responded.

"I would advise against that, Captain. That fruit is only recommended for human consumption if properly prepared. I do not know what kind of effects it will have on you if you eat it raw," Tex said, though his monotone voice made his concern sound like it wasn't a big deal.

"Hey, we've already paid for'em. And I'll only have one or two anyway," Amy said, heading out before Tex said anything else.

The trip to the storage bay at the back of the ship wasn't too long at all. As Amy entered it, she immediately noticed that the air wasn't very cold at all. The refrigeration unit really was broken after all. Wishing again that she'd paid more attention to her mechanical engineering classes back when she went to school, Amy approached one of the crates that the fruit was stored in. She stared at it a moment, as sensors in the crate identified her via her retinas, and then the top of the crate opened, with the fruit sitting inside the crate revealed to the world.

The fruits were perfect spheres, about as big as a tennis ball. The fruit's skin was red, with blue splotches dotting the skin's surface, and a small green stem on top. Amy grabbed on, the fruit slightly deforming as her fingers found purchase on its skin. Without further fanfare, Amy ate it at once, getting sticky red juice all over her mostly-naked body and white undergarments.

Amy later wished that she had taken Tex's advice, because without proper preparation...

1513.content:
With just a couple more touches on the control console, the Muffin settled in for a landing at Malphox Five; though that was only the name for the world in English, the other name for the world was pretty much impossible to say with a human jaw and throat structure. Despite sitting at the crux of several important intragalactic travel routes, the Malphox system as a whole had a rather small permanent population, but did have quite a large number of travelers traveling through the area, so goods like the fruit filling up the hold was a safe delivery to the world. This particular trip was so safe that the most exciting thing to happen for Amy was that one of the lighting strips in the small passage connecting the bridge to the quarters had to be replaced, and Tex was more than capable of taking care of that. The job still made money though, enough to keep the Muffin flying for a while longer and that was just fine for Amy in any case.

Exiting the ship, she oversaw the unloading of the crates, even though it wasn’t really needed, she just didn’t have anything else that needed doing at the time. Confirmation of the delivery was soon sent out through the galactic communication net, which was quickly followed by the credit transfer for the job competition. Amy reviewed the relevant notifications on her comm unit, and nodded after confirming everything was in order, which now left her the matter of whatever her next job might be. Almost as if on cue, another message pinged in her inbox. Opening it up, she saw that it was indeed an offer for a job, and it was even starting from here, but there wasn’t any identity information about who was hiring her. Frowning, she saw that the client wanted to meet with her in a public location to discuss the specifics. Her frown deepened when she saw that the public location was a tavern located in the spaceport.

Amy hemmed and hawed about checking this offer out, it seemed kind of fishy, but it wasn’t like it was happening in a dark alley or anything and if push came to shove, she had her upgraded blaster in easy reach on her hip. She checked in with Tex and let him know what she was heading off to do, before heading out in the sparse crowd outside the landing bays. She had to call up a relevant map in order to find this place, but soon enough was passing through the doors. She was momentarily taken aback at just how many people were packed into the building, and from where she was standing, she only saw a few other humans in the place, with the vast majority of the crowd being made up of various alien species.

Amy glanced around, but didn’t see any obvious signs to whoever was supposed to contact her. Squaring her shoulders and keeping her head on a swivel, she made her way through the thronging crowd towards the bar. After ordering a mild drink, she made her way to one of the back corners; she felt safer having a wall at her back and a view that covered most of the rest of the interior, and settled in to wait for a while and see what came of it.

152.content:
Amy had already checked most of her bags in at the reception area of the spaceport, and was now carrying on a bag with her. She looked up at some of the holographic displays, confirming that the ship she was taking would be leaving from Gate 3. Finally, she boarded the ship, sinking into her seat with a sigh. It hadn't been easy, making the decision to leave her home and go to another planet. But Amy felt that it was for the best; she felt that staying on Earth would just restrict what she could do, out among the stars.

Less than an hour later, the ship filled up with its passengers and lifted off into the starry sky. Amy observed the outside through the window seat she was in. It was a good enough view for the first 10 minutes of the trip, but eventually it became rather boring to see the same scenery over and over. And it was because of this that Amy nodded off, falling asleep before she knew it.

She was woken from this slumber by the sound of screaming.
